title: Does length of the cable affect charging a mobile phone? - Quora

response.answer_text: In theory, a short cable would allow for faster charging (lower resistance → more amps → faster charging), but at the current we are talking about (a few AMPs typically), this is mostly inconsequential for reasonable lengths of cable. You would find far more of an effect from whether the phone is powered off (not using charge), some apps are running, if the phone data IP connection is on, etc. Of course, this is under the assumption of reasonable length … meaning that if the cable were many, many, MANY feet, then you would definitely see a bigger difference.

Length of the cable is undoubtedly affect the charging and data transfer. However, the effect on slow charging devices are very low but you can clearly see it on modern fast charging devices. You can test it by connecting 2–3 male/female USB connectors.
